Articles.Content:
On the 22nd of this month, these forums will go into Maintenance mode. During this process, no posting will be allowed. The following is planned,

The 4 Largest Sections on the KSP Forums will be 'Archived.' The Archives do not allow posting, but do allow you to read and look.

The Forum will undergo a minor restructuring. To be determined on the maintenance day. Some forums will be moved, other\'s removed.

If you have anything you wish to keep, copy it now. Better safe than sorry.

-DR
Any idea on how long the outage will last?

So Development, General D, RP, and Projects?

Or is it Offtopic in place of one of those, since its got a few less posts but more topics (and less important ones, at that)

If you do archive Projects, might I suggest limiting it to posts with a last post January 1st or earlier (Feb 1st might work too)

Well this isn\'t a surprise to me.

Eh, could be WAY worse like the forums shutting down for good.

Well this isn\'t a surprise to me.

Eh, could be WAY worse like the forums shutting down for good.

Well that\'s just a fantastic attitude to have! Thank you! Anyway, the forums will only be down for a few hours.

A few hours without the KSP forums... I can do that.

Sure I can.

I ca...

My kerbal this is terrible!

No seriously, I check these forums almost every hour, I already miss you now. xD

A few hours without the KSP forums... I can do that.

Sure I can.

I ca...

My kerbal this is terrible!

No seriously, I check these forums almost every hour, I already miss you now. xD

Uhg find another game to keep you occupied, like Minecraft.

(That\'s what I play to design figure out my rocket designs.)

Fixed, I\'m on Tribes Ascend now. Still not the same.

Anyway good luck with the maintenance!
Will we still be able to ask a mod to move our topic after the archiving? Or do we have to save our threads before the archiving?
If I understood it correct then we have to save it ourself...

If you have anything you wish to keep, copy it now. Better safe than sorry.

Safe? You can still search your topic and ask a modator to give you the source code of the thread so you can repost it. Or just move it and reopen it.

say - if you wanna 'unarchive' a thread of your own, just ask us... the archives are like any other board, so it\'s pretty simple to just move stuff in and out

don\'t worry, you shouldn\'t 'lose' anything... but then, if by any chance you do - let us know :thumbup:
